alert.note: Alert for Dunn; McLean; Mercer (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued August 24 at 2:21PM CDT until August 24 at 2:45PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN DUNN...WEST CENTRAL MCLEAN AND NORTHWESTERN MERCER COUNTIES... At 220 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Mckenzie Bay Recreation Area, or 33 miles northwest of Beulah, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. This severe thunderstorm will remain over mainly rural areas of northeastern Dunn, west central McLean and northwestern Mercer Counties, including the following locations... Indian Hills State Recreation Area, Twin Buttes and Fort Berthold. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. If on or near Lake Sakakawea, get away from the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. remember, lightning can strike out to 15 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.
